indicator.description: 1. Número de libretas de pasaportes seguros entregadas a satisfacción

baseline.comment: 1. 2011:Libretas de pasaportes entregadas en 2011 712,749 2. 2012: 2738 casos atendidos con tratamiento ARV 3. 2012: 8 acciones formativas a nivel nacional

target.comment: Compra de 554,696 libretas para pasaportes y 151,883 láminas de biodatos para el año 2014

actual.comment:
Meta alcanzada ya que se compraron y recibieron conforme las 554,696 libretas para pasaportes, y 151,883 láminas de biodatos para el año 2014.
Actualmente en fase de liquidación financiera.

target.comment: Compra de 210,000 libretas y 55,000 folios de 4 láminas cada una para pasaportes ordinarios para el año 2015

actual.comment: Se recibieron la totalidad de libretas de pasaporte (210,000) en octubre 2015, quedando pendiente de recibirse las láminas de biodatos debido a dificultades con la impresión en las mismas. Luego de superar las pruebas hechas en noviembre se ha pactado la entrega de las mismas para enero 2016.

baseline.comment: Economic and Social Council, convened, launched and first meeting for its establishment held.

target.comment: Meta 1: Redefinición del espacio de dialogo y restructuración organizativa.

actual.comment: Meta 1: Se redefinió el espacio de diálogo con la instauración de espacios de diálogo tematicos y multisectoriales. Para el 2014, se instaló a traves de un Decreto Ejecutivo el Consejo Nacional de Seguridad Ciudadana y Convivencia.

target.comment:
Meta 1: Fortaler los espacios de diálogo.
Meta 2: Diseño e inicio de implementación de mecanismos de diálogo para alcanzar acuerdos en temas estratégicos de país

actual.comment:
Meta 1: Secretaría Técnica del Consejo operando.
Meta 2: Se instaló del Consejo Nacional de Educación. Se han realizado 6 intercambios de experiencias, donde el CNSCC ha recibido expertos internacionales en materia de seguridad.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Número de Informes de Procesos de Adquisición Generados 2. Número de Contratos de Obras Administrados 3. Número de funcionarios del MOP que participan en actividades de formación y fortalecimiento de capacidades de acuerdo a los resultados esperados del Proyecto 4. Avance del documento de Política de Logística 5. Número de funcionarios capacitados en equidad e igualdad de género.

baseline.comment: 1. 2012: 45.69% ejecutado del presupuesto de 2012. 2. 2012, 97.5 días promedio de los procesos de licitación en MOP 3. Línea base 2012: 0 4. 2012: no existe política institucional de género

target.comment: M1: Al menos 6 informes de procesos de licitación de los proyectos de infraestructura realizados. M2. Al menos 15 funcionarios del MOP capacitados M3. Lineamientos y plan de acción de la Política de género validada. M4. Documento de la Política de Logística terminado.

actual.comment: R1: Un informe de procesos de licitación generado (San Julián) debido a retrasos en la entrega de las carpetas técnicas por parte del MOP y por retrasos en procesos de licitación del Centro de Servicios del PNUD. R2. Meta alcanzada y superada. Se capacitaron mas de 50 funcionarios del MOP en diferentes modalidades de formación. R3. Meta alcanzada; Lineamientos validado por el Isdemu. cumplidos todos los apoyos requeridos para el funcionamiento de la Unidad de Género y capacitaciones de transversalización de género a personal directivo y formador dentro del MOP. Se logró llevar capacitación de género a comunidad de San Julián, en donde se está ejecutando una obra, con la participación de la Unidad de Género del MOP. R4. Documento de la Política de Logística terminado por parte de PNUD, actualmente se encuentra en la etapa de socialización con el MOP y CEPAL como etapa final para su implementación.

target.comment: M1: Documento de Política de Logística publicado. M2: Número de talleres o seminarios en equidad e igualdad de género. M3: 12 Informes de Procesos de Adquisición Generados M4: 12 Contratos de Obras Administrados

actual.comment: R1: Documento de Política de Movilidad y Logística validado listo para publicarse. Este producto contribuirá a brindar criterios de enfoque territorial y desarrollo económico a la priorización de la obra pública. - En la última Junta ejecutiva del 16 de Noviembre de 2015, el Ministro informa que se espera el lanzamiento de la política por la Presidencia de la República para Enero de 2016, por lo que el avance de esta acción se deja en 95% R2: Seguimiento al Plan de Acción de la Consultoría de Género Fortalecimiento de la Unidad de Género del Ministerio de Obras Públicas, que contribuirá a dar ejes transversales para aplicarse no sólo al interior del Ministerio, sino en los términos de referencia de las licitaciones de Obra Pública en el futuro cercano. - De acuerdo al plan de acciones trazado, que sufrió modificaciones y ajustes durante el año con el seguimiento cercano de la especialista en género de PNUD apoyando a la Unidad de Género del MOPTVDU, se superaron las metas: 380% de funcionarios capacitados en equidad e igualdad de género (57 en total de 15 esperados, 27 mujeres y 30 hombres de diversas unidades del MOPTVDU); además, el 3 de diciembre fue el lanzamiento de la Política Ministerial de Igualdad y Equidad de Género en un evento masivo, en el que el Ministro con el apoyo de PNUD hace la entrega al ISDEMU. R3 y R4: Se tienen 11 Informes de Evaluación terminados (algunos después de un segundo o tercer proceso de licitación), para un cumplimiento de meta del 92%; del mismo modo, al cierre de 2015 se contará con al menos 11 contratos firmados de las 12 obras encomendadas, lo que implica que en el 2015 inició la administración del 92% de obras, las cuales finalizarán en parte en el 2016, junto con la 12va obra en licitación, cuyas ofertas se recibieron a mediados de diciembre.

result.title: Objective
result.description: To promote inter-sector approaches to BD conservation through the tourism and fisheries sectors

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Area of mangroves throughout the coastal/marine zone

baseline.comment:
Baseline Level was updated (Source: 2010 Map of Ecosystems of El Salvador, MARN-PACAP)
Jiquilisco Bay 21,191.12 ha
Jaltepeque 7,162.00 ha
Barra de Santiago (Garita Palmera, Bola de Monte) 2,497.00 ha
Costa del BÃ¡lsamo (San Diego, Toluca) 393 ha
Golfo de Fonseca (Cerique, El Tamarindo and La UniÃ³n) 8,979.00 ha
Los CÃ³banos (Barra Salada, other river mouths) 495 ha
TOTAL 40717.12 ha (2010)

target.comment:
Target Level was updated based on the Baseline Level (Source: 2010 Map of Ecosystems of El Salvador, MARN-PACAP)
Jiquilisco Bay 21,191.12 ha
Jaltepeque 7,162.00 ha
Barra de Santiago (Garita Palmera, Bola de Monte) 2,497.00 ha
Costa del BÃ¡lsamo (San Diego, Toluca) 393 ha
Golfo de Fonseca (Cerique, El Tamarindo and La UniÃ³n) 8,979.00 ha
Los CÃ³banos (Barra Salada, other river mouths) 495 ha
TOTAL 40717.12 ha (2010)

actual.comment:
The project has been able to conserve the target mangrove areas (21,191.12 ha) as a result of the joint efforts of the several governmental institutions MARN, PNC, CENDEPESCA, local governments and communities. The recent published "Fifth Biodiversity National Report" list the following: Jiquilisco Bay: 21191.12 hectares, Jaltepeque: 7162.00 hectares, Barra de Santiago: 2497.00 hectares, Costa del Balsamo: 393 ha, Gulf of Fonseca: 8979.00 hectares, Los Cóbanos: 495 ha. Mangrove areas in El Salvador have been maintained, achieving the Project’s goal, as a joint effort between the institutions and the general population.
The environmental zoning document was formulated within the Project, and it has been and promoted to all coastal municipalities on June 2, 2015, by MARN. The municipal governments are supporting the efforts for the conservation of the mangrove and other resources through the creation of 7 municipal regulations (Acajutla, Intipuca,Conchagua, San Dionisio, San Alejo, Jiquilisco, Meanguera del Golfo) which creates a better protection of the natural resources. MARN continues with the declaration of new protective áreas, late december 2014 the área Bara de Santiago was declared as Humedal Ramsar with an extension of 11,519 hectares, making it a new tool for the ecosystem’s management

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of turtle nests throughout the coastal/marine zone

baseline.comment:
Lepidochelys olivacea 6,409
Chenia mydas agassizii 1,279
Dermochelys coriacea 23
Eretmochelys imbricata 80
TOTAL 7,791 (2008)

target.comment:
Lepidochelys olivacea 6,409
Chenia mydas agassizii 1,279
Dermochelys coriacea 23
Eretmochelys imbricata 80
TOTAL 7,791 (2014)

actual.comment:
During the reported period a total of 11,723 sea turtle nests have been tracked in the 2014-2015 season and distributed as follow:
Lepidochelys olivacea 11,479; Chenia mydas agassizii 48; Dermochelys coriacea 18; Eretmochelys imbricata 181.Turtle nesting varies from one year to another, however, due to the constant monitoring of MARN and the support of the PNC, the proposed goal of the Project during this period has been surpassed. MARN supports the different efforts for the conservation of the marine turtle in the whole coastal area of El Salvador, among other actions it executes the “ Action plan for the conservation of marine turtles in El Salvador 2010-2020” which seeks to provide guidelines and operative work liniments for the sustainable managing of the marine turtles nationwide; prioritize the conservation actions according to the opportunities and the dilemmas and define the mechanisms for the implementation of the same plan. CENDEPESCA presented the country’s report about following the excluding devices of marine turtles (TED’s) device that allows the sea turtle to escape the net used to catch shrimps. Achieving more than 70% of inspections done

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Area of live coral populations in Los CÃ³banos Conservation Area

baseline.comment:
Porites lobata 0.1 km2
Psammcora obtusangula 100 m2
Psammcora stellata 1m2

target.comment:
Porites lobata 0.1km2
Psammcora obtusangula 100m2
Psammcora stellata 1m2

actual.comment: CENDEPESCA and MARN have worked all year in the preservation and conservation of the reef popolation in Los Cobanos, and have involved the participation of the local communities and local government. The Project has been updating Los Cobanos Management Plan and is in the process of completing the RAMSAR´s file to be presented at the end of August 2015. The project has been supportive to MARN’s management of wetlands, with provision of specialized team for the monitoring of coral reefs that allows a greater and precise measurement of the coral reef’s areas. Resulting in an increase in relationship to the areas reported during the rise of the base line.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Available shrimp biomass

baseline.comment: 266 metric tons (year 2005)

target.comment: 1,000 metric tons

actual.comment: The project is in the final stage of preparing the 2015 biomass study, that will be finished in November. MARN in coordination with CENDEPESCA has developed different efforts heading to the protection of shrimp and other species reproduction areas, where we can mention the reduction of fishing through pumping mainly at the Bahia de Jiquilisco and greater control to avoid the fishing through net dragging in the three marine miles by industrial ships. Establishment of vans for shrimp catch which develops each year

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Policies and regulations of the tourism and fisheries sectors support forms of production that are compatible with resource sustainability and biodiversity conservation

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Existence of National Policy for Sustainable Tourism, incorporating provisions for biodiversity conservation

baseline.comment: Overall Tourism Development Plan exists

target.comment: National policy and plan exist for the promotion and development of sustainable tourism, incorporating provisions for biodiversity conservation

actual.comment: MITUR-CORSATUR is applying the National Tourism Policy on a daily basis activities and it is one of the main strategic tool to guide at a national and local level to approach sustainalbe tourism development. A National Gobernance Sustainable Tourism Plan for the coastal zone was launched and it will be the base for present and future tourism programs and projects, the Ministers have announced the importance of having this new plan. In addition, Educational tourism guides have prepared as another result.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Existence of a Sustainable Fisheries Policy

baseline.comment: National Fisheries Policy exists but does not make explicit provision for considerations of biodiversity conservation and sustainability

target.comment: Sustainable Fisheries Policy developed jointly by CENDEPESCA and MARN, and under implementation

actual.comment: It is plan to launch in september 2015 the Sustainalbe fisheries policy, which CENDEPESCA in coordination with MARN have been puting together during an intensive consultancy process, where different sectors related to this activity have been participating and the incorporation of biodiversity conservation and sustainability of fishery resource have been a main focal approach.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of active members of Sustainable Tourism Network (STN)

baseline.comment: Sustainable Tourism Network does not exist

target.comment:
Active members of STN include:
- MITUR
- CORSATUR
- Representatives of private sector tourism operators
- Muicipal governments

actual.comment: A second course on Biodiversity and Sustainable Tourism and adaptation to climate change is given to an additional group of 30 tour operators, to strength their abilities in planning and implementing sustainable tourism.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of municipalities throughout the coastal/marine zone actively collaborating with central Government institutions in planning and promoting BD-friendly tourism and fisheries.

actual.comment: 18 municipalities of the coastal zone have worked together with government and other organizations putting together several results and creating an impact on sustainable tourism and conservation of biodiversity: a study on estuary and marine fishery has been done, 8 legal instruments on environment and biodiversity protection are done in the same number of municipalities, two municipalities are members of rural community tourism bureau, environmental education processes is taking place and it is coordianted with MARN, support to women in the marketing of seafood is underway, projects on conservation of sea turtles are underway and supported by 4 municipalities. MARN has submitted the zoning study generated through the BPT project to each of the coastal municipalities.This has allowed them better understanding of the effects caused by extreme events, such as the heavy sea in May this year, thus becoming a management tool

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Level of advance with the development of norms for sustainable production in the fisheries and tourism sectors

baseline.comment: The General Law for the Ordering and Promotion of Fisheries and Aquaculture has been implemented but there are significant weaknesses in terms of monitoring and control in its application

target.comment: The General Law for the Ordering and Promotion of Fisheries and Aquaculture and its regulation have been updated, including norms for sustainable fisheries.

actual.comment:
Draft of the General Law for the Management and Promotion of Fisheries and Aquaculture still under revision to be summited this year for approval.
Seven municipalities have prepared local legal instruments related to biosiversity conservation.

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Number of key institutions with functioning systems for monitoring the condition of natural resources

baseline.comment: MARN

target.comment:
MARN
MITUR
CENDEPESCA
CONAPESCA

actual.comment: Four institutions (MARN, CENDEPESCA, National Civil Police, and MITUR-CORSATUR) have developed functional systems for monitoring the state of natural resources: training and GPS application, equipment for data processing of fisheries is under implementation; 2 new vessels for monitoring and biodiversity conservation have been provided. Monitoring capacities of MARN have been strengthened through a national radio system for the location of industrial vessels (1,500 km²), as part of strengthening of the Environmental Observatory, in coordination with CENDEPESCA. MARN’s MARN´s Wetlandhas taken place by updating the fisheries statistical system (diagnosis of the current statistical system and proposal of improvements; fingering of 35,000 field ballots with information on fishing disembarkments in order to feed the database).

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Number of institutions with specific strategic guidelines in their strategic plans for the conservation and regeneration of natural resources

target.comment:
3
MARN
MITUR
CENDEPESCA

actual.comment: MITUR- CORSATUR is implementing the National Tourism Policy and has officially launched the National Gobernance and Sustainable Tourism Plan for the Coastal zone. CENDEPESCA has a fishing policy, which includes the conservation of biodiversity and the sustainability of the fishery resource and a Draft of the General Law for the Management and Promotion of Fisheries and Aquaculture is underway.Seven municipalities have prepared legal instruments on biodiversity protection.

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Producers have the capacities and motivation to operate in accordance with principles of resource sustainability and biodiversity conservation

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Average size of molluscs and crustaceans caught in Los CÃ³banos

baseline.comment:
Strombus galeatu 20.65 ± 4.56 cm
Striostrea prismatica (Ostrea iridescens) 12.5 cm
Panulirus gracilis 6.2 ± 9.3 (hembras) cm

target.comment:
Strombus galeatus 25 cm
Striostrea prismatica (Ostrea iridescens) 15 cm
Panulirus gracilis 7.0 cm

actual.comment: A study is underway with special emphasis on these species and it will be ready by november 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Average size of shark (S. lewini) individuals caught

baseline.comment: 50cm

target.comment: 100cm

actual.comment: Currently the project is finishing an update study on sharks information and also it will provide information of the impact obtained by the government ban´s that takes place each year. According to a 2012 shark report done by Cendepesca, the average size of capture species is 51.73 cm. However, CENDEPESCA established a ban during the breeding period, avoiding the capture of individuals under 150 cm for one month in 2014 and 2015.

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Number of fishers selling directly to consumers in main urban markets

baseline.comment: 46 members of El Cuco ADESCO

target.comment: 144 organized fishers in CÃ³banos, sell directly to consumers (e.g. tourists, the general public, restaurants and businesses)

actual.comment:
171 organized fishermen in cooperatives are commercializing their products directly to final client (individuals, markets, restaurants, etc): 23 fishermen from Cooperative Tiburoneros of the High Seas of Acajutla.
34 from Cooperative Los Cóbanos, 36 from Cooperative ACOPACIFICO.
47 from Cooperative ASPESCU, and
31 from Cooperative ACOPPSEMPET.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Number of fishers adopting BD-friendly standards throughout the coastal/marine zone

baseline.comment: 325 (2.5% of the total)

target.comment: 650 (5% of the total)

actual.comment: 653 fishermen continue implementing friendly fishing practices with biodiversity, using methods and fishing gear permitted by the competent authority, such as handline, longline , gillnet or permitted fishing areas.These fishermen have been receiving advice and supports to use 4” fisher net , whereby the catch of juveniles decreases.Investigations are under development to assess the productivity of artificial reefs.

indicator.title: Indicator 5
indicator.description: Number of artisan fishers that are members of fisheries cooperatives

actual.comment: Ministry of Agriculture has reported 180 fisheries cooperatives with 4,424 members

indicator.title: Indicator 6
indicator.description: Unit prices received by fishers in Los CÃ³banos participating in schemes for direct marketing of produce to consumers in main urban markets

baseline.comment:
Shark:
$1.00/lb Paid to fishers
$3.20/lb Paid by consumers
Shrimp:
$2.25/lb Paid to fishers
$5.89/lb Paid by consumer

target.comment:
Shark:
$1.90/lb Paid to fishers
$3.00/lb Paid by consumer
Shrimp:
$3.68/lb Paid to fishers
$5.50/lb Paid by consumer

actual.comment: Fisheries Cooperatives report: Shark: $ 1.35 paid to producers and $ 2.25 paid to the intermediary; and Shrimp $8.50paid to the producer, and $12.00paid to the intermediary.

indicator.title: Indicator 7
indicator.description: Proportional contribution of nature-based tourism to tourism sector revenues

actual.comment: MITUR-CORSATUR information, at least 30% of tourist operators are implementing environment and biodiversity friendly activities. With the new Sustainable Tourism Policy and the National Plan for Governance and Management of Sustainable Tourism in the coastal-marine area of El Salvador, more tourism operators will increase sustainable practices.

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: National and local institutions are able effectively to support the mainstreaming of biodiversity considerations into management of the coastal/marine zone

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of municipalities with staff designated to supporting and regulating production activities in line with BD considerations.

target.comment: 18hav

actual.comment: 18 municipalities continue with assigned staff who is responsible to apply biodiversity protection and environment approach and to apply the different legal framework, mechanism and instruments like the environmental zoning of the coastal-marine area and are members of sustainable tourism network. Also 32 municipalities have surveillance system with the National Civil Police’s support.

indicator.title: Indicator 2
indicator.description: Number of tourism operations (hotels and restaurants) subjected to annual inspection of BD impacts and mitigation measures (by central and municipal Government, sector self-regulation entities or certification bodies)

target.comment: 25% of registered businesses in 18 coastal municipalities

actual.comment: A reporting system has been designed, which will increase the companies with annual inspections in 15%.Indicators on status and conservation of biodiversity are being included in the evaluation instruments of MARN and MITUR/CORSATUR (RNT).

indicator.title: Indicator 3
indicator.description: Area of the coastal/marine zone covered by zoning and sustainable development plans for tourism and fisheries

baseline.comment:
145km2 of aquatic reserves (5 reserves)
213km2 of special management regimes (Los CÃ³banos and Gulf of Fonseca)
Zoning and sustainable development plans exist in Jiquilisco Bay and (in process) Los CÃ³banos

target.comment: 1,500 km2 (3 miles seaward and same inland)

actual.comment: The document with guidelines for decision-making in 1,500 km2 of the coastal marine strip has been reported and put it into practice.Indicators on status and conservation of biodiversity are being included in the evaluation instruments of MARN and MITUR/CORSATUR. There are also guidelines for environmental zoning in Los Cóbanos, and the eastern part of the coastal marine strip; and action guidelines for the orderly use of resources scale 1:25, 00; and environmental zoning of the territorial units of high and extreme environmental sensitivity scale 1: 5,000, and their respective performance guidelines.

indicator.title: Indicator 4
indicator.description: Amount of funds channelled to monitoring, control and promotion of BD-friendly activities from private sector corporate responsibility programmes and municipal fiscal mechanisms

baseline.comment: To be determined at project startup

target.comment: To be determined at project startup

actual.comment: $951,932.03 in funds channeled to the supervision, control and promotion of environmentally friendly activities with the BD, from corporate responsibility programs of private companies to municipal fiscal mechanisms.

baseline.comment:
Baseline: El 48.5% de las personas inscritas en el padrón electoral votó en las últimas elecciones del 2012.
El 53% de esos electores fueron mujeres. En el 2009 no hubo desagregación por sexo de las estadísticas electorales
Fuente: TSE.

target.comment:
55% de personas inscritas en el padrón electoral votan en las elecciones de 2014. El 53% son mujeres
Padrón Electoral 2014: 4,955,107 (Mujeres: 2,611,314 y Hombres: 2,343,793)

actual.comment:
Se supero el porcentaje meta fijado de 55% de personas inscritas en el padrón electoral votan en las elecciones de 2014,dado que votaron el 61%.
A la fecha no hay datos desagregados por sexo en todo el territorio. Se conoce que en el gran San Salvador la votación de mujeres supero el 53% estimado.
Padrón Electoral 2014: 4,955,107 (Mujeres: 2,611,314 y Hombres: 2,343,793)

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Número de proyectos incluidos en el Programa de Modernización de los Activos Estratégicos de CEPA ejecutados (Aeropuerto Internacional del El Salvador (AIES), Puerto de La Unión y Puerto de Acajutla)

baseline.comment: 0 (No se han realizado mejoras importantes desde 1998.

target.comment: Al menos 20 proyectos del Aeropuerto Internacional de El Salvador y 2 del Puerto de Acajutla gestionados, ejecutados y administrados por CEPA; y la pre-inversión ejecutada para el Plan Global de Inversiones del Puerto de Acajutla.

actual.comment:
1. Aeropuerto Internacional El Salvador: Se alcanzó la meta de 20 proyecto gestionados, ejecutados y administrados por CEPA. Actualmente los proyectos terminados se encuentran en la fase de liquidación financiera para que CEPA los active en su inventario institucional.
2. Puerto de Acajutla: Se alcanzó la meta de 2 proyectos gestionados, ejecutados y administrados por CEPA. EL proyecto más emblemático fue la construcción de un sistema de tratamiento de aguas negras, bajo un enfoque de cuidado del medio ambiente, ingeniería verde y la renovación del sistema de manejo de aguas negras de las instalaciones el Puerto que tienen mas de 50 años.
3. Pre-Inversión Plan Global de Inversiones del Puerto de Acajutla: Se finalizó la pre-inversión de los proyectos del puerto de acajutla que cuentan con financiamiento, inclusive alcanzando a licitarlos finalizar el 2014 con varios proyectos en ejecución. El grupo de proyectos que no cuentan con financiamiento dependen de la definición de CEPA, aunque el proyecto ya cuenta con los fondos aprobados para realizar esta gestión una vez sea solicitado por la contraparte nacional.
En el 2014, del total de US$66,980,260.63 de proyectos financiados, se ha contratado y gestionado un total de US$59,326,843.69 y quedan pendiente de gestionarse en el 2015 únicamente US$7,653,416.94.

target.comment: M1: Al menos 50% de los proyectos con financiamiento del Aeropuerto Internacional de El Salvador ejecutados y liquidados a CEPA. M2: Al menos 50% de los proyectos con financiamiento del Puerto de Acajutla ejecutados y liquidados a CEPA.

actual.comment:
Al cierre del 2015 se tiene un total de 57 contratos dentro del proyecto: 37 del AIES, 1 del Puerto de La Unión y 17 del Puerto de Acajutla que ascienden aproximadamente a $ 58.3 Millones de dólares.
En referencia a la meta anual, al momento se han liquidado financieramente a CEPA 33 contratos del AIES-MOARG equivalente a un 70.3% ($37.4 M) y 16 contratos del Puerto de Acajutla equivalente a un 79%($3.9M).
Paralelo a la liquidación financiera se está llevando a cabo la entrega oficial de archivos de los proyectos a CEPA según el procedimiento establecido y a la fecha se han entregado 42 de los 57 contratos de esta fase del proyecto.
El porcentaje del avance de la ejecución total de los contratos de esta fase, al cierre del 2015 corresponde a 93.76%.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: Número de Módulos SIGOB implementados. Numero de Instituciones que desarrollan SIGOB. Número de procedimientos de la administración pública reforzados

baseline.comment: Un módulo SIGOB implementado en El Salvador. Anteproyecto de Ley de Función Pública elaborado y en discusión.

target.comment: Al menos un módulo SIGOB implementado en institución pública. Se cuenta con un borrador de ley que fortalezca la administración pública salvadoreña

actual.comment: Se implementaron dos modulos en el Instituto Salvadoreño de Bases Magisteriales (ISBM): TRANSDOC y METAS Se cuenta con anteproyectos de ley que fortalecen al administración pública: Ley de Procedimientos Administrativos y Ley de lo Contencioso Admnistrativo.

target.comment: Al menos un módulo SIGOB implementado en institución pública. Al menos una propuesta es presentada para movilizar recursos y se socializan los marcos regulatorios de la Ley de Procedimientos Administrativo y Contenciosos Administrativo.

actual.comment: 1. En el ISBM se desarrollan dos modulos SIGOB con exito. En Septiembre 2015 Se realizó una visita de seguimiento al ISBM para recibir sus comentarios luego de implementar SIGOB Metas y TransDOC, fueron muy positivos, ellos colaboraran con PNUD para incidir en la utilidad del portafolio SIGOB y expandirlo a otras instituciones publicas. 2. Se ha desarrollado un diagnostico de los principales desafios de la administración pública salvadoreña y se han realizado contactos para la movilización de recursos con el Centro de Politicas Públicas de PNUD en Singapur y en Korea, se han presentado dos propuestas para continuar desarollando la iniciativa. Asimismo, se contacto en HQ a la iniciativa GEPA, Gender in Public Administration para incorporar la perspectiva de genero en la administración publica, ellos estan definiendo sus estrategias globales, por ello no se ha trabajado conjuntamente. 3.Un elemento importante, es que las propuestas normativas que se elaboraron el año pasado, han sido retomas por GOES, en el caso de la Ley de Procedimeintos Administrativos, el GOEs a traves de FOMILENIO implementara esta iniciativa legal en su componente de mejora regulatoria.Asimismo, se han retomado los contactos con la Corte Suprema de Justicia para impulsar la agenda de modernización del la justicia administrativa en conjunto con la academica y stakeholders.
